get.summary: Give information about current API version

post.summary: Fit a GWAS model. This endpoint take Urls of geno and pheno data (and values of other GWAS parameters) and write an a json file to the give Url using a PUT request. It had been disign to work with amazon S3 services.

parameters.name: geno_url
parameters.description: url of the markers data file (.vcf.gz file)

parameters.name: pheno_url
parameters.description: url of the phenotypic data file (csv file)

parameters.name: upload_url
parameters.description: url of the PUT request for saving the model

parameters.name: trait
parameters.description: name of the trait to analyze. Must be a column name of the phenotypic file.

parameters.name: test
parameters.description: Which test to use. Either `"score"`, `"wald"` or `"lrt"`. For binary phenotypes, test = `"score"` is mandatory. For more information about this parameters see: https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/gaston/versions/1.4.9/topics/association.test

parameters.name: fixed
parameters.description: Number of Principal Components to include in the model with fixed effect (for test = `"wald"` or `"lrt"`). Default value is 0. For more information about this parameters see: https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/gaston/versions/1.4.9/topics/association.test

parameters.name: response
parameters.description: Either "quantitative" or "binary". Is the trait a quantitative or a binary phenotype? Default value is "quantitative".

parameters.name: thresh_maf
parameters.description: Threshold for filtering markers. Only markers with minor allele frequency > `thresh_maf` will be kept for the GWAS analysis. (default 0.05)

parameters.name: thresh_callrate
parameters.description: Threshold for filtering markers. Only markers with a callrate > `thresh_callrate` will be kept.

get.summary: Adjusted results. This endpoint calculate the adjusted p-values of the gwas analysis and return all the results or only the significant adjusted p-value. The results are return in json format.

parameters.name: gwas_url
parameters.description: url of the result file saved by `/gwas` (json file)

parameters.name: adj_method
parameters.description: correction method: "holm", "hochberg", "bonferroni", "BH", "BY", "fdr", "none". Default: "bonferroni". (see https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/stats/versions/3.6.2/topics/p.adjust for more details)

parameters.name: filter_pAdj
parameters.description: threshold to remove points with pAdj > filter_pAdj from the plot (default no filtering)

parameters.name: filter_nPoints
parameters.description: threshold to keep only the filter_nPoints with the lowest p-values for the plot.

parameters.name: filter_quant
parameters.description: threshold to keep only the filter_quant*100 % of the points with the lowest p-values for the plot (default no filtering)

parameters.name: thresh_p

get.summary: Draw a LD plot. This endpoint return a png image.

parameters.name: geno_url
parameters.description: url of the markers data file (.vcf.gz file)

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: lower bound of the range of SNPs for which the LD is computed (`from` must be lower than `to`)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: upper bound of the range of SNPs for which the LD is computed (the total number of SNP should be lower than 50)

parameters.name: ped_url
parameters.description: url of the pedigree file (.csv)

parameters.name: header
parameters.description: a logical value indicating whether the file contains the names of the variables as its first line. The default value is TRUE. In any cases, the column 1 will be interpreted as the individual id, column 2 as the first parent, column 3 as the second parent.

parameters.name: unknown_string
parameters.description: a character vector of strings which are to be interpreted as "unknown parent". By default: missing value in the file.

post.summary: Simulate genotypes of progenies of given parents

parameters.name: geno_url
parameters.description: url of the phased genotype file of the parents

parameters.name: crossTable_url
parameters.description: url of the crossing table data file (`csv` file of 2 or 3 columns). It must contain the names of the variables as its first line. The column 1 and 2 will be interpreted as the parents ids. The optional third column will be interpreted as the offspring base name.

parameters.name: SNPcoord_url
parameters.description:
url of the SNPs coordinates file (`csv` file). This `.csv` file should have 4 named columns:
 - `chr`: chromosome name holding the SNP
 - `physPos`: physical position of the SNP on the chromosome
 - `linkMapPos`: linkage map position of the SNP on the chromosome in Morgan
 - `SNPid`: ID of the SNP

parameters.name: chromosomeInfo_url
parameters.description:
url of the chromosomes information file (`csv` file). This `.csv` file should have 3 named columns:
 - `name`: chromosomes names
 - `length_phys`: chromosomes length in base pairs
 - `length_morgan`: chromosomes length in Morgan
 If this file is not provided, the chromosome lengths will be set to the largest SNPs position of each chromosome.

parameters.name: nCross
parameters.description: Number of cross to simulate for each parent pair defined in the crossing table.

parameters.name: upload_url
parameters.description: url of the PUT request for saving the simulated vcf file
